DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Disease Anatomic Site Direct Or Image-Guided Therapy Procedure Location Access Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response as to whether the location of the disease site within the body is accessible to direct or ultrasound guided therapeutic injection procedures, as outlined in the protocol, in order to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Disease or Disorder Anatomic Site Direct Or Image-Guided Therapy Procedure Location Access
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Named locations of or within the body._As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The use of imaging techniques to provide the basis for therapy, e.g., enabling surgeons to visualize internal structures through an automated overlay of 3D reconstructions of internal anatomy on top of live video views of a patient. Also used for guidance of biopsy needles._The site in or on the body at which the procedure is performed._The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Anatomic Site Direct Or Image-Guided Therapy Procedure Location Access
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Named locations of or within the body.:As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The use of imaging techniques to provide the basis for therapy, e.g., enabling surgeons to visualize internal structures through an automated overlay of 3D reconstructions of internal anatomy on top of live video views of a patient. Also used for guidance of biopsy needles.:The site in or on the body at which the procedure is performed.:The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Named locations of or within the body.
As an immediate result; having nothing intervening; without deviation or interruption.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

The use of imaging techniques to provide the basis for therapy, e.g., enabling surgeons to visualize internal structures through an automated overlay of 3D reconstructions of internal anatomy on top of live video views of a patient. Also used for guidance of biopsy needles.
The site in or on the body at which the procedure is performed.
The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have sarcoma in
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have sarcoma in the extremity or trunk in location, which is accessible to direct or ultrasound guided injections?
